body:
@NZKoz @tenderlove it's pretty foggy what was the original meaning. That option was not working at all, so I don't think was used too often. 

Yes, it's only for JSON parser goals - 
```
<script> var x="</script>" 
```
fails, of course. And we need to escape it - Thus - current implementation of escaping really should be set to +true+ by default - just nothing stops us, obviously a good idea.

The subject is to make *real* HTML escaping - protect developers when their $('body').append(comment.body) w/o escaping. controversial issue. OK, We can leave it "as is" but maybe raise some attention to the problem at security page? 

https://gist.github.com/2655020
https://gist.github.com/2665901

Am I only guy who found kind of that moronic code in my repos? If yes - nothing should be added :) But both attitudes seem common to me.

thanks.
